text: Flonicamid is a pyridine organic compound used as an insecticide on aphids, whiteflies, and thrips. It disrupts insect chordotonal organs that can affect hearing, balance, movement to cause cessation of feeding, but the specific target site of the chemical is unknown. It is typically sold as wettable granules mixed with water before spraying. ==References== Category:Insecticides Category:Nitriles Category:Trifluoromethyl compounds Category:Pyridines Category:Drugs with unknown mechanisms of action
title: Flonicamid
